Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid with dowturned rim; interior glazed black with added red bands near and on rim; underside of rim reserved; exterior, from the centre, part of three rays; band of single dots between black bands; black-figure decoration consisting of hindquarters of deer to left and rump, tail, left hind leg and paw of feline to right; incised spoked rosette as filling ornament; at rim, band of dots between black bands; on outside of rim band of blobs or ivy leaves, much worn.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 340-1, no. B412)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0787) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 9)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
